explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

self_reactive_substances.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive or self-reactive properties present in the molecule.

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures, which in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: The chemical structure of the substance does not contain metals or metaloids(B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At).

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Organic compounds containing no oxygen, fluorine and chlorine.

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Although it is classified into the class 8 in UNRTDG, identification with skin caustics cannot be performed.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Calculated based on the following data: Rat LD50 value: 930mg/kg (ACGIH 7th, 2001), 660mg/kg (ACGIH 7th, 2001) and 980mg/kg (SIDS, 2001). Since the calculated values was 693mg/kg, it was classified to category 4.

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: It was set as Category 4 based on rabbit LD50 value: 2000mg/kg (ACGIH 7th, 2001).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: Based on rat LC50 (1 hour) value: 3.75mg/L (4-hour equivalent 0.938mg/L) (ACGIH 7th, 2001) and LC50 (4 hours) value: 0.8mg/L (SIDS, 2001), it was set as Category 3.

skin_corrosion_irritation.hazard_statement: Causes severe skin burns and eye damage
skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: From description that caustic is in the skin of the guinea pig by apply of a stock solutions (ACGIH (7th, 2001)), and description that internal bleedings were acknowledged in 3 minutes, the necrosis was acknowledged 5 minutes afterward, and the erythema of the skin, dropsy, bleeding, and a necrosis were acknowledged in the all examples of six animals 60 minutes afterward by apply on the rat skin (SIDS (2001)), and bleeding and a necrosis were acknowledged within 60 minutes by skin apply to a mouse, it was judged that there was caustic, and it was set as Category 1B.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Since we found the data which stated that it had skin corrosivenesses in the test using the rat (SIDS (2001)), we classified it as Category 1.

respiratory_skin_sensitizer.classification: Respiratory sensitization: Classification not possible; Skin sensitization: Category1
respiratory_skin_sensitizer.hazard_statement: (Respiratory sensitization)-; (Skin sensitization)May cause allergic skin reaction
respiratory_skin_sensitizer.rationale: Respiratory organ: No data. Skin: We categorized it as Category 1 based on the description that positive rates of sensitizing property was 70% in maximization test using the guinea pigs in SIDS (2001).

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: There is a negative result (SIDS, 2001, ACGIH 7th, 2001) by the micronucleus test which used the mouse erythrocyte ,which is an in vivo mutagenicity test using a somatic. So it carried out the outside of Category.

toxic_to_reproduction.rationale: It was considered as out of Category based on the description that reproductive toxicity was not observed at the dose in which general toxicity is observed in parental animals in the oral administration simple reproductive toxicity studies using the rat (the Health, Labor and Welfare Ministry reports (2005), SIDS (2001)).

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: It was judged as Category 1 (respiratory tracts) because of descriptions in ACGIH (7th, 2001) and SIDS (2001) referring to that effects on respiratory systems were confirmed at concentration within the limits of guidance value of Category 1 through a inhalation exposure test using rats.

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Based on descriptions that no significant toxic effect, except for the disorder against the gastric mucous membrane, was observed with dose exceeding the guidance value range for Category 2 in the oral administration study on rats (the Health, Labor and Welfare Ministry reports (2005) and SIDS (2001)), it was classified as out of Category. Since there was skin corrosivity, the effect of oral administration on the digestive system was judged to be local effects, and they were not taken as target organ.

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 3 from 72-hour ErC50=14mg/L of algae (Scenedesmus) (SIDS, 2003).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Harmful to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Classified into Category 3, since acute toxicity was Category 3 and not rapidly degrading (BOD: 22% (existing chemical safety inspections data)), though less bio-accumulative (BCF<2.7 (existing chemical safety inspections data)).
